answerText: The Inheritance of Loss[10] The author of The Inheritance of Loss, Kiran Desai, is in a relationship with the author of this work. In this novel, the poet Ka returns to Turkey from exile, prompted by reports of women committing suicide after being forced to remove their headscarves.
heading: Missiles of October |2011 | 4 | 10 | Literature | World | College
subject: Literature
question: Question: One character in this novel falls in love with her math tutor Gyan, a Nepalese political agitator who is disgusted with her upper-class status. For 10 points each: [10] Name this novel, which compares the privileged Sai's life in India with the immigrant Biju's struggles as a laborer in the United States. It won the 2006 Booker Prize for its author, Kiran Desai.
